history.proof: intros b b0 b1 H. destruct b0, b1; simpl; auto. - destruct b; auto. - destruct b; auto. sfirstorder depth: 3. - hauto lq: on depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall b b0 b1 : bool, leb b0 b1 -> leb (b0 && b) (b1 && b)

Premises:
leb = fun b0 b1 : bool => if b0 then if b1 then True else False else if b1 then True else True : bool -> bool -> Prop Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
andb_inc_r : forall b b0 b1 : bool, leb b0 b1 -> leb (b && b0) (b && b1)
lem_get_leb : forall (m0 m1 : Map bool) (a : ad) (b0 b1 : bool), lem m0 m1 -> MapGet bool m0 a = Some b0 -> MapGet bool m1 a = Some b1 -> leb b0 b1
leb_transitive : forall a b c : bool, leb a b -> leb b c -> leb a c
leb_antisymmetric : forall b c : bool, leb b c -> leb c b -> b = c
andb_prop_intro : forall b1 b2 : bool, Is_true b1 /\ Is_true b2 -> Is_true (b1 && b2)
eq_bool = fun b0 b1 : bool => if b0 then if b1 then true else false else if b1 then false else true : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
orb_andb_distrib_r : forall b1 b2 b3 : bool, b1 || b2 && b3 = (b1 || b2) && (b1 || b3)
absorption_andb : forall b1 b2 : bool, b1 && (b1 || b2) = b1
N.add3_bits_div2 : forall a0 b0 c0 : bool, ((N.b2n a0 + N.b2n b0 + N.b2n c0) / 2)%N = N.b2n (a0 && b0 || c0 && (a0 || b0))
Nat.add3_bits_div2 : forall a0 b0 c0 : bool, (Nat.b2n a0 + Nat.b2n b0 + Nat.b2n c0) / 2 = Nat.b2n (a0 && b0 || c0 && (a0 || b0))
andb_orb_distrib_l : forall b1 b2 b3 : bool, (b1 || b2) && b3 = b1 && b3 || b2 && b3
ssrbool.andb_idr : forall a b : bool, (is_true a -> is_true b) -> a && b = a
orb_andb_distrib_l : forall b1 b2 b3 : bool, b1 && b2 || b3 = (b1 || b3) && (b2 || b3)
andb_prop_elim : forall a b : bool, Is_true (a && b) -> Is_true a /\ Is_true b
negb_andb : forall b1 b2 : bool, negb (b1 && b2) = negb b1 || negb b2
Reflect.andE : forall b1 b2 : bool, is_true (b1 && b2) < -> is_true b1 /\ is_true b2
BinInt.Z.add3_bits_div2 : forall a0 b0 c0 : bool, BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.b2z a0) (BinInt.Z.b2z b0)) (BinInt.Z.b2z c0)) (Zpos 2) = BinInt.Z.b2z (a0 && b0 || c0 && (a0 || b0))
Init.Nat.ldiff = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise (fun b0 b' : bool => b0 && negb b') a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
leb_reflexive : forall b : bool, leb b b
ssrbool.negb_imply : forall a b : bool, negb (implb a b) = a && negb b
ssrbool.orbK : forall a b : bool, (a || b) && a = a
ssrbool.negb_and : forall a b : bool, negb (a && b) = negb a || negb b
andb_false_intro1 : forall b1 b2 : bool, b1 = false -> b1 && b2 = false
andb_assoc : forall b1 b2 b3 : bool, b1 && (b2 && b3) = b1 && b2 && b3
andb_orb_distrib_r : forall b1 b2 b3 : bool, b1 && (b2 || b3) = b1 && b2 || b1 && b3

```coq
intros b b0 b1 H.
destruct b0, b1; simpl; auto.
- destruct b; auto.
- destruct b; auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros b b0 b1 H. destruct b0, b1; simpl; auto. - destruct b; auto. - destruct b; auto.
